intro: Heteropanax chinensis var. longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-peduncled heteropanax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like China, Vietnam, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated petioles and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
